metadata.title: CVE-2020-26960 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: If the Compact() method was called on an nsTArray, the array could havebeen reallocated without updating other pointers, leading to a potentialuse-after-free and exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox <83, Firefox ESR < 78.5, and Thunderbird < 78.5.

criterions.comment: firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
